CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 16, 1954, pg. 16, reads: "'Aida' Makes Curtain - 'Aida,' presented by the National Negro Opera Foundation, Inc., and its Pittsburgh Opera Guild, at Syria Mosque Saturday night overcame difficulties and answered critics of the effort by giving a commendable performance. It was a tribute to Mme. Mary Dawson, founder and organizer of the NNOF, and her associates.  Upper left, one of the colorful court scenes of Verdi's immortal masterpiece, with Angelo Gatto conducting members of the Pittsburgh Symphony in pit..."
TitMainTitle: National Negro Opera Company production of "Aida," posed on stage of Syria Mosque, with conductor Angelo Gatto leading orchestra in foreground
